title: ReelWave: A Multi-Agent Framework Toward Professional Movie Sound Generation
author: Zixuan Wang (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Chi-Keung Tang (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Yu-Wing Tai (Dartmouth College), ...
relevance_why: The multi-agent framework and use of interpretable control signals in this paper can improve audio generation tasks in Haohe Liu's research, particularly in generating supervised audio from visual inputs.
background: This paper develops a system that generates synchronized audio for video content, enriching the sound design across multiple scenes using an interactive, multi-agent approach.
contribution: ReelWave introduces a multi-agent framework for generating on-screen and off-screen movie sounds, achieving more contextually coherent and synchronized audio outputs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing models for video-to-audio generation often focus on single-scene contexts or lack interactive feedback mechanisms.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances audio generation by integrating feedback loops between multiple agents, allowing for iterative refinement of sound design.

key_innovation: The framework's role-playing structure among agents, including a dedicated Sound Director overseeing the generation process, is unique to this approach.
real_world_impact: ReelWave can significantly streamline audio production in filmmaking, creating richer auditory experiences that align with visual storytelling. It could lead to enhanced efficiency in sound design workflows.
limitations: The video feature encoder used is noted to have limitations with longer video sequences, which could impact performance in certain contexts.

new_terms.Foley: **Foley** refers to the reproduction of everyday sound effects that are added in post-production to enhance audio quality and provide a more realistic ambiance.
new_terms.Cross-attention: **Cross-attention** is a mechanism allowing a model to focus on relevant parts of different input sources, facilitating better interaction between video features and audio properties.
